summary: The 'DHS Basic Training Accreditation Improvement Act of 2025' mandates annual reporting to congressional committees on the accreditation status of basic training programs within the Department of Homeland Security. It requires the Secretary of Homeland Security to report on accreditation dates, managers, and reasons for any lapse in accreditation. The bill also tasks the Under Secretary for Science and Technology with researching technologies to improve access to federal law enforcement training for state, local, tribal, and territorial law enforcement, particularly in rural areas, focusing on terrorism and homeland security preparedness.
